entry.p: Don't ask me where I've found the time, but over the last six weeks I've posted a whole raft of public-domain texts over at the Monadnock Press — writings by the likes of Plato, Aristotle, Cicero, Horace, Peter Abélard, John Locke, Victor Hugo, Edmond Rostand, Willa Cather, Mark Twain, H.L. Mencken, and Frederick Douglass (the first time that his speech Self-Made Men has been published on the Internet, as far as I know). Next I'll work to finish my translation of the Vatican Sayings by Epicurus. Enjoy!
